content.description: A sample of <math alttext="15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> golfers who played a golf course on a certain day was selected. For each golfer, the average driving distance (<math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>), in yards, and the percent of fairways hit on the drive (<math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>) were recorded.
content.question: The scatterplot displays the percent of fairways hit versus the average driving distance. Also shown is the least-squares regression line, <math alttext="y hat equals, 66.228, plus 0.0002 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>y</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>66.228</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.0002</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. The point circled on the scatterplot is considered an influential point. A new least-squares regression line will be calculated with the influential point removed. How will the removal of the influential point affect the new least-squares regression line for the remaining <math alttext="14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> points?

choices.label: The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept will remain the same, and the slope will be negative.
The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept will decrease, and the slope will be negative.
The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept will decrease, and the slope will be positive.
The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept will increase, and the slope will be negative.
The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept will increase, and the slope will be positive.

content.answer: The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept will increase, and the slope will be negative.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
